twv5koRkoxv803AXyy2wig.text: Such a gem of a place to have found in the heart of Earl's Court! It's such a handy place to have nearby too! This place is fantastic not just to eat in but also to have takeaway. It's always crowded so reservations are advised. Most of the food I've tried here are magnificent along with the service. These include: morning glory cod, fish cakes, prawn phad Thai and green curry, prawn red panang curry. Only bummer is that they don't take american express.

A8ywDBjxAGzSXTyE6EG7ZQ.text: What great food!  We ended up in London over the weekend on a whim and found this little gem.  The service is a little inattentive, but the food is wonderful.

K0aeFW21cJbRTnHOtMSstQ.text: A very quaint place with not a tremendous amount of seating, but the food is spectacular.  I have never had much luck with food in Britain aside from the ubiquitous fish and chips, but this was some of the best Thai cuisine I have experienced.  ANYTHING you try will be great.  We had several dishes, including the pad thai.A 3-4 minute walk from the Earl's Court tube station.Offers home delivery

PVclmiDxLdz4qyGNDKEMqA.text: I love to eat Thai. So, I had fairly high expectations of Addie's, and I'm pleased to say it served to perfection. I traveled with my family, and we were FAMISHED. Addie's seemed like a great place, and it was. From the large menu to the attentive waiters (with excellent English, might I add) to the delicious food, I loved it all the way through. The duck is excellent. 2 thumbs up to Addie's!

1mh6sZH65xXVVHTyiXaCbw.text: Coming from Thailand this restaurant is as authentic as it gets. Addie's is open quite late which is a plus. Things to order include the duck and soft shell crab. Definitely a must for thai food cravings.

JpzVG0NsI4hqyrsP7CV9gw.text: A great Thai place-- delicious seafood options, awesome pad thai and a fun atmosphere. Casual, but very clean and aesthetically pleasing. The staff gives good recommendations and will tell you what ingredients are in something if you don't know.

WeIRwQbTo9kQQ2-WQS04lg.text: Fun to get back here on a visit to London.  Great food and friendly people.  Always busy, but always fast and efficient to match.

eXu8f3EGbUartzh5A0pOyA.text: Completely mediocre Thai food. Is this the norm in London?

DumCSE21MtQ61ZaW9jBeQA.text: Never been to Addies? You have never had Thai! Simple. Amazing decor, very friendly service and the Amazing decoris to die for. Full of flavours that are exquisitely presented

noItYbs8ZAcZR6txpvXkOg.text: I've only ever been to Addies one time last July, and I've been wanting to head back ever since. If you want authentic Thai food, you have to try Addies! The restaurant was packed when we arrived, and we had to wait a bit, even though we had placed reservations. I cannot fully recall what we ordered, since we were a large group, but I remember the dishes were truly tasty and memorable. Our Thai friend had recommended the place, and she ordered most of the dishes. You'll find that many Thai and Chinese people frequent this place.. so if you wish to sink your teeth into genuine Thai food without leaving the country, Addies is the place to go. Prices and portions are very reasonable. We paid under £20 per head the last time we were there, and this included drinks, starters, main courses and we were completely full by the time we rolled out of the restaurant.

HVIpMYBqXt1FK6lMjlMLOQ.text: i am from thailand and i can say this place has great, authentic thai food. i was surprised to see many of the items on the menu that i don't normally see in thai restaurants in the US.

b3SD97pCTcibX9CdH1SLXQ.text: Fantastic Thai restaurant tucked away in Earl's Court road. We visited from overseas and miss good Thai food. Lovely range of dishes and well priced. Staff were super polite too.

l3zL_7ii7B5qykF9E4sfHQ.text: Food was about average compared to other thai food I've had, but they get a single star for the service. When I first walked in, the hostess asked if an hour and a half max was ok. I said sure, that'd be more than enough time. But 30 minutes later after I'd finished my meal, they actually came up and asked me to leave. I get you want to move tables faster, but then don't say an hour and a half in the first place.

B9Cci4whXVD3OwriiacLGw.text: This restaurant is always busy. Make sure you book in advance. The food is good. However the service is a bit of a shame. Otherwise everything else is great in this restaurant.

J8dkafAP__3XoJTvywwG9w.text: This is hands down the best Thai food I have ever had in my whole life.  Ever.  I had green curry and it was fabulous!  It was spicy and I didn't have to ask for it that way.  Yet it wasn't full of red chili flakes.  It had the perfect balance that you look for in Thai food.  It was freakin delicious! Plus you can order sticky rice instead of steamed or fried.  What a treat!  Honestly though, we were sat by the kitchen and I wish I would have been more adventurous when I chose my meal.  Everything that came out of the kitchen looked and smelled amazing.  I have to go back here...as soon as possible.

CKeRabZ4KYuSFiCIyrvNYg.text: We went to 100% Design at Earls Court yesterday and so had the opportunity to go back to my old stomping ground with friends. Addie's looks very odd from the outside and based on this first impression you might choose not to go there BUT you'd be missing out! The place is always filled with Thai people, which should give you some indication how good the food is... it's mouthwateringly delicious! In contrast to the outside, the atmosphere inside is friendly, the menu comprehensive and the service excellent. Whether you're a local or are just visiting the area, Addie's comes with a five-star rating in my book!

m9bhntloS-PCKCcPzGQNIQ.text: Worst service I have experienced ever!I booked a table for 4, 2 of us arrived on time and have to wait for our other friends to arrive to be seated. We were sent downstairs to the supposely 'bar' with really loud music. Tried to talk to the waiters but they will turn around pretending they didn't see you! Finally got the speak to one of them, he asked me to go upstairs MYSELF to talk to the manager. I went up, talked to one of the waiter, he question my time of arrival with a super arrogant attitude. 1)There's no point booking a table there because they still make you wait.2)Incredible staff who can pretend they can't see you waving in front of them.3)When I said I'm going to leave they just say, OK! and didn't even apologize!

7xsU6SojWBgWL82L54tNMQ.text: Good foodPleasant atmosphereBut somehow the waiters seem not very friendly like they don't want to service their customersWe came here many time but everytime it is not very impressiveThey should provide better service so that they could maintain loyal customerService is Suck

wN3bDJRVJyQGWw5AQJy21A.text: I found Addie's based on Qype recommendations, and was not disappointed. I arrived on my own about 7.00pm on a Wed and was immediately seated. The restaurant was busy but did not feel crowded, the staff were efficient and I easily attracted their attention when needed. Not being a Thai regular, I appreciated the descriptions in the menu and was able to order what I wanted. The food was superb - what I imagine good Thai home cooking might taste like. I had prawns in spring rolls with a hot sauce as a starter, and a duck curry with plain rice as my main course. Both were as described on the menu. The curry in particular exceeded my expectations with a rich creamy sauce bursting onto my tongue with so many flavours - it was just a great experience. Sometimes all it takes to be great is not to get anything wrong. Addies ticked all the boxes on service, atmosphere, price and especially quality of food, so all round this restaurant is a great find that i will be taking friends back to.

_8lRbLCL_TPSce0W4BFPHw.text: This has been my local Thai restaurant for some time now; I love it. It is informal, consistently delicious, with good service and relaxed atmosphere. The cuisine is authentic but beware! when they say 'hot' they mean 'hot'. Prices are very reasonable at around £7 for a main course and around £3 or £4 for starters.

ek87D0c14eBCSpDfujXmUA.text: Oh man. This may be my favorite Thai restaurant in London. If you know any better places, let me know! I think I've been here at least twice and have always been impressed.I came to Addie's expecting a very typical place. There are tons of little restaurants up Earl's Court Road. Many of them are fine but not amazing. This one is amazing -- and priced about the same.What I love about Addie's: The food is fresh, the sauces are surprising and spot-on. Oh, and they aren't afraid of spicing it up -- a lot. We had a pork starter that left our mouths burning, but in a good way. The duck main course recommended by our server was unexpected and delicious. Gluten-free notes: They were able to tell me what did and didn't have soy and oyster sauce, making gluten-avoidance delicious and easy.

JI8RLiAGPdoWJNyc0pGH2w.text: Unfortunately I do not share this enthousiasme: money bags overfried, satay precooked (charcoal broiled?, as mentionned on the menu). And so on. Abundant amount of ketjap does not make Thai food. Disappointment.

p3_RFviRpzEjYrrtRlJuxA.text: Thai tea with no ice is charged for extra. Brilliant pad Thai and som tum. Green curry is ok.

fWXQBpHrsgDuKP5rdyx2KQ.text: We've visited this place a few times and the food was inconsistent between the three trips.  The first time we went it was good, second time very good, third time it was really poor quality and the flavours were not there.  Will probably try once more when we are in the area again but not as consistent as other place we have been.  Staff are generally friendly and the restaurants is very clean.

AEDtFln-3FAh0B0tSipVhw.text: My favourite Thai place in London. Curries are a bit of a let down but Thai curries are not my favourite things in the world so it's not going to impact my rating.  The steamed fish is to die for.  I can slurp that sauce/juice all day, every day.  The Tom Yum is also fantastic.  To be honest, all the dishes we've ordered have been good with the exception of the curries.

f1VrJ--caNMr4dawXI9uVg.text: Book in advance or go early. Great Thai food , go with a group and share plates. Love the steamed sea bass and Green curry.  Everything tastes fresh, you'll love it.

KQ_sIVXIQYn2px_s5vqs7Q.text: The food was pretty good, the only thing I didn't like was rushing. I know its a small place and they want as many customers as they can get but they did everything very fast. They came take order as soon as I opened menu, they took my glass as soon as I finish my drink, they bring my bill even when I was still eating. Like I said the food was very good and came very fast so if you don't mind being rush go for it :)

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

nSKvJlfq9Ad5QBH_BbYzrw.text: Called for delivery. I was quoted "2 hours for delivery because the restaurant is quite busy." Um, seriously? Don't advertise as having a delivery service if you cannot accommodate.

RK9L7Ae69oc90O_FYUJaLA.text: We split the Drunken Noodles and the Beef Masaman.  Both were quite tastey.  The drunken noodles were surprisingly spicy, and the potatoes in the curry were cooked to perfection.  Prices were fair and we left full and happy.

1gj9DzgBIlqauPTdBdPijg.text: Just the best Thai food I've ever had in life, that's all.    I could recommend specific dishes, but why?   Every dish our table had was just killer.   Duck was wonderful, everything was perfectly spiced.   Place was clean.   Service was attentive.   I am jonesing for this place.

vd58DbWCilyg344HfESZQg.text: I had the stir fry and the coconut sorbet. Service was great, and the food was incredible. Holding out on giving 5 stars because of portion size, but you definitely get what you pay for. Solid 4 stars.

MpwWo4FkT82yYeoRKqsZbw.text: absolutely fantastic thai restaurantfood, service, setting, price Glad it's small and unknown : keep it secret!

KgK4X1ad45kTN4wm8h6YKQ.text: Nothing to write to your mother about!  Food was good enough, I've had better Thai food in San Diego, CA.  Place was pack and hot. AC was not on.

FuNk0Tp9Maz4uBXI8xIq3g.text: Addie's Thai is an Urban Legend; and for good reason too. They've been here since 1987, and are still going strong; not surprising, as they've perfected the art of serving Oriental fast food that places the sole priority of satisfying the eater's tastebuds first, way before everything else. It's all about the flavour; there are no corners cut here when it comes to tending to the tongue. The flavours are over-the-top, massively indulgent, satiating, animated in appearance, glutinous, and gluttonous; a real treat, leaving the mouth awash with pure satisfaction, with lips curled up at the side in sheer delight. When it boils down to it, 'Oriental delivery/takeaways' are a treat really, aren't they? You don't eat this type of food to get healthy, do you? You eat it because it tastes good; it tastes different; it's the opposite of boring isn't it? 'Boring' is boiling a pot of pasta and adding some ground beef to it to turn it into a Spaghetti Bolognese; 'fun' is picking up the phone after a few drinks and having a bit of a bubbly chinwag with the restauranteur, then setting the stop-watch before frantically scurrying around the house like the Tasmanian devil, trying to find some cash (with a fictitious elongated 30-min Countdown theme-tune building up in your head), or for the more sadistic of you, gleefully laying in wait until the order has been relayed, then reveling in the tremendous joy of hearing that ever-so-slight woefully sounding sigh as you connivingly state to the person on the other end of the line I'd like to pay by card please.; the cheap thrill you get and the goosebumps that cover your forearms when the front doorbell goes, it's here!!!; the ceremonial '2001 A Space Odyssey'-styled 'opening of the front door' to greet the spaceman who smells of traffic (who's already reaching out to hand you a big plastic bag filled with your steaming goodyness); the expectation of it all; the pulling of the dishes out one by one from of the bag and trying to figure out what is what and who's is who's; the lid-popping; the sniffing; the obligatory I didn't order this!? comment regardless of the whether or not it was what you ordered; the tucking-in, the munching-with-no-manners, the burping, the small-talk, the guzzling of the fizzy drink right at the end; the playing of 'kitchen-basketbal' with the kitchen bin and the empty containers; and then finally, the last act, the waddling over to the sofa and slumping down in it like a Walrus auditioning for a part in the 'Royle Family'. There's a whole culture involved isn't there? It's an operatic act starting right from the second you pick up the phone. And with Addie's Thai, you are not just 'ordering a takeaway', you are buying a ticket or two for this Oriental opera, that will provide you with the classic takeaway/delivery experience, from start to finish.  As soon as the call is answered, you are greeted by the ever-chirpy, effusively attentive, heart-warmingly friendly host, a lady who's name I have forgotten, who, regardless of the weather, will cheer you up no-end, and by the second call, will know your first name and your favourite dishes off by heart. Slightly lascivious in nature, if you are male, do not be put off by what may seem like flirtatious behaviour; it all adds to the Addie's experience. This is the time to practice some sexual innuendo jokes, or any joke for that matter. The phone-calling here reminds me of communicating with male Air Stewards on British Airways flights; it's got that similar sort of tongue-in-cheek Carry-on style of tone to it. And when the food arrives, you will have no trouble whatsoever with their extremely efficient, polite, methodical delivery staff; have no fear, there won't be any Hey, how's it going geezer?! Did ya watch tha footy?! small-talk here, nor any off-putting 'huffs and puffs' from peeved-off drivers, as the Addie's delivery crew are like commandos, straight in, straight out, hi and bye is all you get (if that), and that's it. For the more frugal of you out there, rest assured, you will not encounter any 'Oxfam eyes' from the driver, as the passing-over of the food is complete, but I always tip anyway, so personal preference is key here. The food is gorgeous. I quickly became an Addie's addict circa 2006/2007, when I was living in an apartment block in South Kensington, and had the good fortune of coming across one of their menus they had left on the counter of the reception down in the lobby. The rest is history. I was ordering at least three times a week from them, and quickly became a regular Alas, I am no longer an addict now, as I went into re-hab (moved 'north of the park'), and as they don't deliver too far from their base-camp, their food is something I will not have the pleasure of experiencing any time soon.  FOOD: Phad Thai: 'Alice in Wonderland'-styled appearance of this staple Thai dish, with whopping chunks of all the ingredients crammed into the container, with the lid literally bursting

8ouFqcI5e7Prr5ISZDSd0w.text: We tried Addie's Thai upon the recommendation of our airbnb host and it did not disappoint.  At this tiny neighborhood spot, charmingly decorated, we were warmly greeted upon entry and seated as soon as a table for two opened up (we had not called ahead).   Friendly, efficient service and delicious food at reasonable prices.

c2W3NGHipzNWi-nDB7pzrw.text: Plenty good, and we go back regularly. Best consistant Thai I've had in London. Not quite SriPraPhai in Queens, NY but very good nonetheless.

N_zj6kGv97dC7EfporGeJQ.text: All around great experience. They took our party without a reservation providing we would be finished in 90 minutes . We lingered and enjoyed every minute. Wonderful favors and competent service. Great value for the $. We will be back.

PsxZeyCW42LF8cOxI8ivwg.text: Sateh (Chicken skewers) - 6/10 - the chicken was bland, but the sauce were very goodTamarind Pranws - 7/10Rice noodle side dish - 4/10 - good size portion of rice noodles easily shared by 2 people. Unfortunately, it was bland.

muXLoObV6aQsDkKG_1jVQA.text: As a New Yorker visiting London on business, I was pleased to find Addie's near my hotel. Excellent food, very affordable, casual but pleasant atmosphere. Had the Larb chicken and Pad Khing veggie, both of which were very tasty. The "two peppers" markings are pretty serious, so if you can't take spicy food, better order it mild!

l35K9gr-9Z6vZDS3O5Yh-w.text: I learnt about Addie's from people who generally don't ever go to Earl's Court. Yes, it's got a reputation that has spread far and wide. I've only been here twice so far as I don't live in the area (the most recent visit being this week), but it's well worth a visit, and is a great stop on your way back in if you've decided to drive out somewhere outside of London.Anyway, let's get down to the restaurant itself. Addie's has got great decor but is rather small. Hence, if you're able to book, you should. Staff well, I think 90% of them are incredibly friendly, while there was one who seemed a bit surly and abrupt while taking our order, saying And then? in a rather sharp tone after every item we ordered. Still, the rest of the staff were friendly and smile-y so it wasn't enough to put us off.The food was absolutely divine. I'd gone for the pork neck in tamarind sauce as a side dish and it was delicious. The sauce was very spicy though and almost killed me. My friend's masamman curry was not bad, but he said he'd had better elsewhere. The pad thai, which every Thai restaurant has to serve, was good, and looked very pretty with an egg lattice over the top. Be sure to mix in the chicken floss and crushed peanuts on the side before eating though. My friend didn't and missed out on the crunchy, savoury extras.Our bill wasn't too bad. Came up to £22 each including a drink and service for quite a fair bit of food.

iee9zivHAy7nHiOz0YKdpA.text: Good food, very good prices for the area, good service, friendly staff and fast!  Massaman Curry was delish. Go here if you want good Thai food at a good value in Earl's Court area.

McDM_HOhH3xxcVR0jGVg3A.text: I ordered the Drunken Duck for take-out. There was a miscommunication over the phone, but the staff was willing to accommodate me by preparing a free drink and promptly preparing the dish. While waiting for my dish, I saw the presentation of the food for those who were seating and it looked nice.The dish was very good. It was a proper stir fry and the peppers used were extremely spicy but tasteful. All was cooked perfectly, and I plan to return and try the other dishes offered.

U5B8gQH5pJGi9DieKi6WHQ.text: Holy hotness.  We didn't have a reservation but they fit us in around 9pm on a Saturday when we arrived.  I had the basil chicken, the basic dish which I use to judge all Thai places.  I like it pretty spicy and will typically ask for a 4 out of 5 of hotness at American restaurants.  3 out of 5 in very authentic places.  At Addies, I made the mistake of taking a full first bite without realizing quite hot hot their standard is.  The menu said 2 chills out of 4, so I figured it would be fine.  Not true.  I had to perform intricate surgery on my dish to remove all chili seeds from that point on, and whined and whimpered my way through...it was good though, so I finished everything (but the chili peppers).  The service was nice, I drank lemongrass tea.  My bf had the Massaman Curry, which he enjoyed.  They were attentive about bringing more water.  If I live in West London, I'd definitely return.

alWvDjsN6h10bpQH7yrVog.text: I read all the other reviews and compare it to my experience here and feel robbed. I was convinced to come here after a friend said this was the only Thai spot she would order from when the craving for Thai hit back in her uni days - so I had high hopes.I got the sea bass sweet chili and she got the satay chicken. The sea bass was okay, nothing exceptional. I had the same dish at another Thai restaurant in southwark and that was much better than this one (the fact that I remember it now is testament to that). The breading was a bit too thick for my tastes, the sauce too sweet, but the spiciness was right on target. It wasn't a bad meal, just didn't live up to the high expectations I had. I'd definitely come back and eat here again, as prices aren't bad and other peoples' dishes looked delicious - maybe I'll go for the recommended steamed fish next time.

eaUs_DuLxnQLPgmwVsvVfw.text: Excellent service from start to finish ! If you're looking for an authentic and tasty Thai meal, this is the place to go to, surrounded by many locals.The satay chicken and pad thai were truly delicious. To add a local flavour to your meal, you can also order one of the Thai beers. The place is perfect for dinner. Be sure to come early or book in advance to avoid the long queue.

DpH8ClHp5Rm82UI9XXrU3w.text: I don't know why the Londoners think this restaurant is any good. I went there based on the reviews and was really disappointedThe curry was not spicy, it was sweet.The lady who took the order didn't understand what I asked and instead of letting me know that the food came with fried meat she said yes its grilled and it was fried.too bad i wasted an evening here...

E0Oagch6ZtT2o3ekMp3RLA.text: 4 Stars for great value and great food!I ordered Pad Thai. The price was EXTREMELY reasonable for London and the pad thai was great. A little on the greasy side, but still nice. The service was great as well......

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai - was great!! (a little greasy, but that's okay with me)
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Addie's Thai

x3Jx420QWS243RbitZravQ.text: My husband found this gem on yelp and we loved it!  Tasty, fresh food served quickly by a very friendly staff. We tried the Weeping Tiger as recommended by someone on yelp and it was awesome. Would highly recommend this quaint restaurant.

JxYW7Mp07yUjaml2NwYn3A.text: Pretty good food, I personally had the Chicken Pad Thai. I don't think it was anything extremely special, but it tasted good, with a decent serving size as well. Extremely kind and polite service!

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

v6qaisqp__nhkv7opdHtuA.text: Hidden authentic Thai food discovered.  I'd been to London for work for a monthly basis in the past 7 years and can't believe I never knew a out this place.  The food, the flavor are as fresh and authetic as if I was having it in Thailand; which I visited about twice a year.  The aroma and spices on drunken noodles, basil fried rice are some of my favorites here.  On a cold day, hungover or just any day, their noodle soups are truly helpful and fulfilling.  Friendly service, amazing prices, authentic and a guarantee satisfaction.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Thai shrimp fried rice.  Perfectly seasoned and perfect portion.
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Tom yum noodle soup with clear broth.  Super hearty, flavorful and fulfilling.
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Khao Pad Kra Pow or Basil and Chilli fried rice with chicken.  The flavor and the aroma is truly Irresistible.

gdVEYah1r_egW3-KAkPepQ.text: Came here on a Thursday night last week. Had a chicken and cashew nut dish and vegetables with tofu. The portion sizes were good, the taste was great and it was good value. Service was also excellent. So pleased I chose this over one of the big chain restaurants beginning with 'W' that I had seen down the road. On the whole I prefer to support local businesses and I think the food here far exceeded the chain anyway. Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken and cashew nut dish. Think there were 2 on the menu, this was the one towards the top. Forgot to take photo at beginning

YkhpIEK6dT5fOjvnb9_Ffw.text: A casual, little Thai restaurant near earls court, definitely worth booking a table in advance as there was a pretty long queue when we came in.Awesome food, the weeping tiger is superb as was the 'barbecue' pork with excellent sized portions, don't fill up on starters.Be sure to order the Chang beer, two bottles equals a free glass to take home...excellent surprise when we got the bill :)

BvAun7ugBTVQ9pJiFBfOXQ.text: Delicious food (although their spicy was pretty tame) followed shortly by violent diarrhea. Not sure if that's a reasonable price or not.

rVDR4DsxdBzDxQZCk1EzWg.text: Addie's is an excellent value Thai restaurant, slightly away from the main drag of Earl's Court Road, towards Kensington. The food is authentic and well prepared, and service is both efficient and friendly. Although the only Thai eaterie in the area, it nevertheless provides very good value (around £15-20 a head, including beverages). The interior is decorated in warm, pleasing tones, giving it a very cosy ambience. The only gripe I have is that their vegetarian selection is (in common with many Thai restaurants) rather limited, although fish enthusiasts will be spoiled for choice. It's worth trying to book ahead if you can, as they are always very busy, and packed at week-ends. ************************ Update: 17-04-2008 Another excellent meal, and two courses with three bottles of wine between 4 of us came to just under £25 each, including service. They will now do tofu veggie versions of many of the main courses - just ask. Booking now seems essential even on a Monday.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Addie's Thai Cafe

hTMvXL2xnwuYMA2o0Dee3g.text: tasty... this is a quick and easy decision for a green currie din-din after a long day of focused work!  usually i findself too lazy to not just order room service; but this tidy spot is a great restaurant within a quick stroll from the Marriotthighly recommended

aq0q1rxqA_hWFVfedivTnw.text: Surprised that Addie's hasn't garnered a few more reviews!  I first discovered this place about 8 years ago through a Thai friend of my sister's and it's always come through for me.  I thought that the quality dropped off a tiny bit a couple of years ago, but the last time I went, it was as good as ever.  Also, they've redecorated the front of the restaurant - before, I frequently managed to walk right past the place and have to double back due to the total lack of visible signage (and the utterly forgetable pinky-beige paint at the front).The inside of the restaurant is low-lit and fairly quiet, so I guess it'd be a decent date location (not that I know about these things).  I also like that it smells like jasmine rice too which is really pleasant.I really like the curries here - the flavour balance is just right and the sauce is really moreish (I can't say that with all curries...) and they have a decent amount of chilli without being excessive (and I'm sure they'd happily oblige if you want more).  I also really like the salads here too, although they are HOT - it'll take 30 seconds for the birdseye to kick in, but you'll know when it does.  The raw prawn salad is particularly tasty - I know many people are sceptical about eating them, but they have such a unique, almost buttery texture which is lovely in combination with the crunchiness of the rest of the salad.  For the carnivores amongst you. the Weeping Tiger steak is tasty too - I love the marinade.  Lastly, for hot beverage lovers, you should try the lemongrass tea - it's really refreshing.Value-wise, it's excellent for the quality and presentation of the food.  The portions aren't as big as you'd get in some other places, but they're not piddling either.  Most starters are around £4.50, curries are generally under £7 (although they don't come with rice), and main dishes are in the range of £7-£10, so it's pretty reasonable.By far and away my favourite place to eat around Earl's Court - I admit I've neglected it a bit in recent years, but it's some of the best Thai I've had in London and I'd recommend it to anyone in a heartbeat.

z2eK6XweaFuJUgXS4Yw0Sg.text: Addie's is one of the ten or so Thai restaurants in London that cater mostly for the Thai community rather than for native Thai-food lovers. They have an authentic menu including Isaan street-food, and a downstairs area for karaoke parties. The decor is quite cool and modern with gorgeous little scale models of street-food stalls framed on the walls. The place is frequented heavily by London's Thai students - so much so that booking in advance at the weekend is essential. The whole restaurant is buzzing with cool young Thai kids who've spent their parent's money on Kings Road early that day. You can't move for boutique shopping bags.But on to the food and drink... the Thai food is great, but not London's best and the prices here feel a good 20 to 30% more than many equivalents. We had the Isaan sausage (gorgeous but I'd give it London's bronze), a fermented fish som tum (disappointing), fried cat fish in morning glory (wonderful), a spicy lemongrass and pork soup (very sharp) and grilled pork neck (very tasty but not stellar). With rice, sticky rice and a beer and Thai iced tea it came to about 45 pounds.Addie's is definitely worth a try, especially with a big group. Book early and plan to party.

iczNWsZ3PFKHgXYTpCWxKw.text: Spectacular Thai food and added bonus - it cleared my sinuses! Great location just steps away from Earl's Court tube stop. We picked this restaurant because it was just around the corner from our flat and the reviews were stellar.Deceivingly large dining area because you walk into a shotgun style room lined with table-tops on one side. But wait there is a whole other dining area downstairs. Very hip, chic decor but not over the top. Awesome stenciled wall art of Bangkok street scenes. The room was predominantly filled with Asian clientele which signaled that we were in for a treat. Very friendly staff and loads of regulars flowing in/out with big hugs-n-kisses reception. Another clear message that this place will kick ass!We had Royal Addie's Platter to start. This is my new 'last meal' before they shoot me up with electricity. Mix of fish cakes, prawns, chicken satay, spring rolls and moneybags... deep-fried chicken/prawns in pastries. Lordy. Served with a trio of dipping sauces, this was so delicious I was worried the mains might pale in comparison. Perfect crunch on the fried items. Not refried, but prepared fresh to order despite the busy turnover. The fish cakes were sublime. They were flavorful and the perfect texture and left me wanting to place another order. For £11.50, you can't go wrong. Honestly, get this and a main to split for 2 and you'll not leave hungry. I had the Salt with Chili Soft Shell Crab for £12.95 and Man had the Chicken Masaman Curry for £12.95 - not sure of that price. Damn Vince (Van Gogh). Masterpiece. If soft shell crab is cooked improperly, it tends to get chewy and dull-flavored. This crab dish ranked as good as those I've ordered in New England. Yummy. I am normally not a curry lover because coconut milk gets richer with each bite to the equivalent of overindulging on creme brulee. This was not too overpowering and the chicken was incredibly tender. I loved this dinner so much that upon our return home, we researched the most authentic Thai restaurant local to Columbus and found one. Yelp coming soon. Addie's is great all around! Great value. Great location. Great staff. I''ll be craving this place something awful.

dqPkIqGk2fM_hM9yC5IlAw.text: One of the better Thai joints I visited would go there again but really not really good Thai food when you get down to it but by london standards that I have been to okay. - medium quality resturaunts   That is

SGJgHuPBBV4_XRCKtuxyHA.text: Found this place on Yelp...thought I would try it. Omg...this place is so good and true to it Thai taste. All my friends told me, this is a good find. Excellent food...it tend to be a little bit spicy.The restaurant itself is a little small...make sure to make reservation before going if you have a big party. They add 10% service charged to your bill.

ClOjtT7P9yhRKzW_kYo0GQ.text: Found this place through Yelp and decided to give it a shot on a weekday evening. The place is relatively small, but the food didn't take too long to arrive so I can't imagine having to wait too long for a table. My friend and I both got the green curry and asked for it not be too spicy. WORD OF ADVICE: the lady next to us who said she always has spicy food could not even finish a quarter of her curry due to how spicy it was. When they say a dish is spicy, they really mean it! The curry was delicious, but I could have done without the appetizer platter. For how much you pay it isn't that much food and it wasn't particularly flavorful. The actual entree's were so much more flavorful and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Appetizer platter
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Green curry (it's incredibly spicy!)

s6KgoFgesVxjRZWaZGExJg.text: Addies Thai is simply the best Thai food in London. My partner and I must have been here 50+ times and the food is consistently excellent - never too heavy, never too oily, but with generous portions and friendly service.The Thai Ice Tea is great. The starters can be missed, but the cod, pad thai, weeping tiger and massaman curry are all wonderful. The pandan crepe is a great finish. Affordable and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai and Cod.
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Weeping tiger

1m4AkJvlJ0UfxEo4sm8dLQ.text: The quality of Thai food can vary quite a bit in London and I find that the small places like this always turn out to be the best.  We made a reservation for a Friday night as recommended but they won't seat you until your entire party arrives.  They're quite flexible if you all arrive a bit late - and they warn you ahead of time the table turn over is is for an hour and a half.  Not quite the place if you want to have a nice long leisurely dinner.  I shared the spring rolls with a friend and they are quite standard.  Good but how good can they possibly get?  For my main, I ordered the penang curry with chicken with a side of steamed rice.  It was really good and extremely filling.  Compared to other thai restaurants the portions here are a bit more.  The curry was full of flavour and happily soaked up all the goodness with the steamed rice.  My friend ordered the king prawns with red curry which looked really good.  Service is punctual as you can imagine but they didn't end up rushing us even when we went past an hour and a half.  As long as there are tables available, I don't think they keep track - especially if you are finishing up a glass of wine.  Happy to find another good restaurant near Earls Court!

_fWGdBPIiFvIYYyoyvFsng.text: One of the best and most traditional Thai restaurants in London. I've been coming here since I was a baby... Speaks volumes when majority of customers are Thai.

p_6PUeWBrc1tE_cd_zs2lw.text: My husband and I stumbled upon this place after striking out on a pub with no seats available for dinner our first night in London.  What a find!  I had Pad Kratium Ptrik-Thai (13) and my husband had the Pad Thai.  Both were incredible!  Great service as well.  Highly recommend.

dapKwcBu-oqlqC5tYXD7Lg.text: This is my favourite Thai restaurant. I have been there for several times and I highly recommend Pad Thai and soft shell with black pepper! They are really delicious! Thai ice tea is also worth trying!

bSQwqb-CwgRJbDfKIGMLGQ.text: Great food, great value, and great service with no frills/nonsense. With so many restaurants nearby, we were in the mood for Thai and found a place that we would recommend to anyone.  From apps thru desserts...the whole table was pleased and the staff was extremely friendly.

gTYRzfQe95_6jxh7wOOQOQ.text: In my experience, Thai places can be hit-or-miss which makes me think twice about trying new ones. I'm glad I have this place a chance. Everything about it is pretty much right on. The food is great and the service is friendly. One good thing about this place is that you can order and share lots of small dishes. This is great for when you're not sure what you want or you just want to experiment a bit.As of now, this is one of my favorite restaurants in London.

9b377B8M-SVysUSLT-UXvQ.text: I went into Addie's Thai Cafe with no expectations since the Thai food we get in Thai Town Los Angeles is pretty authentic and BOMB.  The modern interior and table settings give out the non authentic - English influenced Thai food vibe. It is definitely different from the Authentic Thai food I've eaten in Thai Town Los Angeles, but the food was pretty tasty!I ordered the BBQ pork leg and steamed rice and my friends ordered the duck.  I didn't really like the duck but the BBQ pork leg was so good!We were really craving Thai Food so we were happy with what he got :)  Would definitely come back when I'm back in London~

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. BBQ Pork Leg

JY8p-vJSKlUOMJW9MUx4pw.text: Came here based on prior reviews.  Excellent food and affordable.  Thom Yam soup delighted the hubby.  Pad Thai was very good.  Even something as basic as vegetable fried rice had the freshest vegetables and perfectly made tofu.  Better than what we have had in the states!

e4uQ8f0Zh6iHq-q7TsXjJA.text: Oh yes. Yes. Yes. Yes. We walked in and it was FULL of Thai patrons. That is always a good sign. It was a Sunday night and they were very busy. The service was a little bit slow, but they were busy. The food was amazing and we nearly licked our plates. One of the best Thai meals we've ever had (says she who's been to Thailand). If only this place were in the US we'd be regulars.

xY7Ym-YPhKuwEfSRhfYZTw.text: Stand-out service from this restaurant. Attentive but not overbearing waiting staff, and our waitress even treated us to a special dessert since we were there for someone's birthday. Fantastic food from this place too- very flavourful. Overall a great evening spent at Addie's Thai cafe!

RNt3X5zEZICW3gI9RhxdWA.text: Addie's Thai Cafe is a hidden gem in the far west of London. Few may contradict but many will likely agree with me that this is the best Thai restaurant in London.Starting with service, upon entry we were warmly welcomed with big smile by the hostess. Oh what a magic this sweet gesture does to guests especially from stoic inhabitants of London. Nextly, while seated to the dinner table, I noticed the calm and zen-like ambiance and decor they created here. It is a typical but good quality of any Thai establishments that Addie's incorporated at the restaurant which I think makes dinning experience enjoyable. As for the food, they have quite a huge selection. It can be overwhelming to those who are new to thai menu but personally I believe it is better to have more  choices than be limited. You can always ask for recommendations from your servers who are very attentive and accommodating. Luckily, we knew what we want and went for it. We had Pad thai, beef ginger stir fry, panang curry and fried rice. Each one of the dishes were perfection. All were tasteful and flavorful that it nicely stimulated our palate and filled tummy. To our surprise, the prices here are on the good value thus making us extra happy to find this cafe. We will definitely be back to explore more their menu.

P9OtS4jl7gb-GxrKdMhOOg.text: This is the only Thai restaurant in London that I keep going back. It is where you would come for authentic Thai food, which in my opinion very close to what you could get in Thailand. The price tag is rather low or moderate, compared to the average price at other Thai restaurants, but you get a decent portion.After several visits, I've already tried around 80% of what's on the menu, and I can say that the quality is very consistent. Therefore, instead of the predictable Green Curry, Pad Thai, I would suggest you go out of your way and try something you've never heard of or tried before.The desserts menu might be less interesting. My friends said that the banana in coconut milk was too sweet for them, but it was fine for me.Overall, highly recommended if you're looking for the authentic Thai food in London.

WaOiYl9_k5UDFnzvzknA2w.text: Best Thai food ever! Mint spring rolls were great! Squid salad the best!  We also had the roasted duck and beef Thai chili and basil. Our favorite meal in London!

ZCZqSiu-5CZYIIs_Pg-VGQ.text: Really great service. Very good, FRESH,  Thai food. It's a good go-to when you're craving Thai! Ambience is casual, but nice. Seating is very close together, but they accommodate larger parties very readily. Solid place.

vrQfJDJraHpHxjXN_2gCHg.text: very delicious!!!I love papaya salad and pad thai!! next time I may try some curry or the pad kra pow moo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. very delicious!!!I love papaya salad and pad thai!! next time I may try some curry or the pad kra pow moo!!

Bky_6AhnU8_HzeYdfgSzcw.text: Clean place. They sat us pretty fast (4 ppl). For appetizers we had papaya salad and the moneybags. Both were excellent! As main we all shared two of the specials: tamarind chicken and the chili fish. We also had the chicken pad Thai and massaman curry. Every dish was delicious! Can't pick a favorite :)

ypUK9JlAnHK3nzM7lZP-tQ.text: Great sizzling steak and Tom Kha soup! An American in London (with many Thai spots back home) was extremely impressed and satisfied! Also very reasonably priced at 22 pounds for a solo dinner with app, entree and glass of wine. Highly recommend!

KZ-qZfiNhXp2v3FahaSUAg.text: i came here for the rad nah. I traveled all the way from East London to Addie's for the rad nah and it was totally worth it. Showed up towards the end of lunch hour and the guy was nice enough to seat me and I told him I would eat fast. My food came out in about five minutes and it was delicious. The guy came by and told me I didn't have to eat fast, it's hot, don't burn yourself, which I thought was funny. I was just eating fast because I was hungry and the rad nah was super tasty. The ambiance is nice too, clean and modern yet cozy with warm lighting.

Sm3hjJ40YvschSQYuQBrmQ.text: Great thai food! Friendly service, delicious food at reasonable prices. The Tom-yam soup, pad-kee-mao with squid and the pad Thai with chicken were great.

CKuT8VEn-DDJLpVVc0lRoA.text: Came here about 730pm on a Friday night and the restaurant was already almost full. Luckily we got a table for two downstairs and was still comfortable with no air con. I travel to Thailand quite a bit so I know what the food should really taste like. My husband and I ordered a few things and I have to say the food was delicious. I was slightly disappointed with the vegetable and tofu in my vegetarian curry but the sauce was lovely. The rice was really good and soft, which is super importAnt. Thai iced tea was just like the ones in Thailand which was nice thirst quench for me. The servers were super busy running around but super nice. The gentleman that took order spoke Thai and I believe most of the servers do which is a good sign! I would def come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

ye8aCxtQV35-BerdMROTKg.text: Didn't get to eat here. Came here about 25  minutes before closing. Was told the kitchen is closed. What's the point of having a closing time if you're not gonna serve customers who abide by that closing time. Terrible service and terrible management if that's how they treat potential customers. Go eat at Siam's Secret for guaranteed great Thai food and who are welcoming of their customers. Look up Siam Secret, their yelp speaks for itself.

ZSqttvzh8gPJ2nk-OXwAJw.text: Located in Earls Court in the avenue of restaurants, if you're in the mood for Thai food Addie's is the place to be. In the menu under rice dishes, I went for the "Khao Pad Ka-Prao" (8.00). I got this in the minced chicken option. What makes it  taste good is that it's mildly spicy, the added garlic, basil leaves and chopped chili gives its Thai flavor. I only wish the portions were bigger though, it does get addicting and you wanting to get a bit more. "Morning Glory" (6.95). Because this was so flavorful, its probably one the best stir fried veggie plate I've tasted in quite a long time. You can see the sauce as the base of the spinach and it tasted sweet and salty. If you're in need of a vegetarian meal I suggest this, it was delicious."Tamarind Duck" (9.95). This tasted okay, the downside was that the meat tasted dry and the tamarind sauce was on the sour side. Other than that it's not too bad. The service we got that night was good, they were attentive and fast. The atmosphere was lively and it looked like a popular dinner hangout place. The environment here has a modern feel to it with its lighting and decorations. For locals and tourists alike if Thai is your thing, it impressed me and I hope it impresses you.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Morning Glory (6.95).
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Khao Pad Ka - Prao (8.00).
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Pretty cool decor

4dA2g966Oi4C1pfHTDSg3g.text: I thought the food offered here was adequate but not excellent.  The flavors were not that striking, so I feel that it was just an OK experience.   Everything was fine, although service seemed on the slow side.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

M7fYdJOG9-QM7Rw0tYH6YA.text: Very authentic Thai food and delicious curries. The staff were very friendly and the food came out quickly. Glad I found this place!

FLrI6-8G43zYsNkBcwiWnA.text: On the last night of our stay I chose to dine here, mainly because of the positive feedback.For a Thursday night it was booming, which reflected its reviews. A few couples were already sat waiting for a table..30 minutes was the estimated wait, to avoid the torrential rain we agreed.Luckily ten minutes later we were beckoned to a table. This wasn't the biggest place in  the world, it was like a run way to the kitchen.The first waiter was polite, and took our drinks order of coke and tsingao beer. We turned to the menus, which was cheap considering we were in kensington. Spicy prawn crackers, prawn & pork dumplings were ordered as a starter. For mains a spicy seafood ramanesque soup , and chicken fried rice were also chosen.Unfortunately the prawn crackers did not arrive with the dumplings, which were average..these were chased when the mains were brought out, which the chef knocked out quickly.My soup had a very flavoursome broth, spiced perfectly. However the flat  rice noodles were flavourless and I could count the pieces of seafood on one hand. My friends rice dish just looked bland.When I looked around , other dishes looked tastier..but what added the salt to the wound was the change in service. The waiter was so rude, especially after I paid the 3% service charge. Even the adjacent couple raised their eyebrows.Overall, mediocre food, with very inconsistent service. I personally don't understand it's high rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Blurry chicken fried rice
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Spicy seafood broth
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Prawn & pork dumplings

R5MprRDdiRtx0EqFtxZ_Wg.text: Authentic thai food with strong flavours. I tried their pad Thai, thai milk tea, and their pancake dessert. Had a bite of my friends fried rice as well, which was really flavourful. The dessert wasn't as worth it, but tasted really good.

dFtCTXAt8ZIPXExgPj9fMQ.text: Went for dinner and enjoyed it very much. I had pad kee mao, which was one of the better ones I have had. The prawns and all the ingredients were very fresh and flavourful. My friend ordered a spicy pork related dish, which he seemed to enjoy as well. Our starter of deep fried dumplings were solid. Service was okay, though given the busy-ness, there was not much interaction with the staff. Nonetheless, everything came out on time and was efficiently managed. Ambience was good, though I wished it had more of a personality. It's not too spacious but just good enough to enjoy a simple, authentic meal.

7NvTdhwzWo8RJua-bC-HUw.text: Oh man this place was great! I'm an American originally from Hawaii and while the British food has been okay, it's definitely different. Sort of lacking in fruits and vegetables, but that's a whole other thing. Basically, we were missing Asian food and noodles. Found this place on yelp near our hotel and I'm very glad I did. You know it's going to be good when you see all the local Asian population at the restaurant and when there's people waiting for a table. Good thing I read the reviews and called ahead to make a reservation!Anyways, went in for our reservation and ordered a Milky Way (Thai iced tea) and a chicken pad thai. Both were amazingggg and I tried some of my friend's pad see ew as well and that was good too. Ended up getting the sticky rice with banana and ice cream for dessert and that was also super good. If I lived around here and needed a go to Thai food place, this would be it. Pretty cheap for London standards I think at 7.50 for the noodle dishes, fast service, and great food.

G6crmNa200Ep32sE53kv8Q.text: Tried Addies on a cold January Sunday evening based on Yelp reviews. Was initially not excited by the decor and the less than warm reception. The place was already almost full ready right after opening so decided to give it the benefit. Glad I did! The Weeping Tiger accompanied by sticky rice was very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

I-hh-LGmxJrAqoOYIpUe6w.text: Our salty pad sew came with a broken piece of glass (size of a pinky finger nail) which my wife thankfully spit out without damaging her mouth. How the hell does a piece of glass get into your pad sew? They just said sorry and removed the dish from my meal. At the very least, the chef or the manager should have properly apologized OR maybe let us not pay period for such an appalling and horrendous experience. Unfortunate that this set the stage as my first meal in London as a traveler. Fried rice was pretty good... until I completely lost my appetite. "Milky way" thai tea was good as well. Too bad our experience was terrible. I'm sure this is just a one off case and others around me seemed to be enjoying their meals.Watch out and check your food though.

x_W7txq5EjNa-r8zoCwYLA.text: My friend has been here a few times and spoke very highly of it, but the last time we wanted to go, we called to try and make a last minute booking, and they were completely full. It's apparently known for having Thai high society living in London come through. The décor is not over the top glamorous, but it's not hole-in-the-wall either; it's comfortable, clean, and also a little cozy.They are apparently known for their Weeping Tiger dish,  which is sizzling sirloin served Thai style. We also got some chicken and prawn toast and an egg omelette, as well as both the egg fried rice and the sticky rice. I enjoyed everything; we got the chicken and prawn toast first, and it totally hit the spot. I've only had prawn toast prior to this... can't say I really tasted the chicken, but it was good nonetheless. The egg fried rice was good on its own, but the sticky rice was recommended to accompany the Weeping Tiger and it came in a cute straw container. The steak was not a large portion, but I liked the way it was prepared and the rich soy sauce went very well with rice. The egg was simple but delicious; this would be a good dish to try and make at home, but I have no idea how they get it so tasty!We were in and out of the restaurant within an hour, and I thought it was great for a quick and delicious meal. That's not necessarily something you expect when you have to book a restaurant, but it is indeed very popular. They seem to be part of a group of restaurants with locations in Twickenham, Chiswick, and Hammersmith. I would love to come back and try some more dishes on the menu - there were so many to choose from!

ibkb18KpsisY3dd5yTeBTA.text: I love the menu here.    Wow what an awesome selection.  I can hardly control myself, there are so many interesting offerings.  The starters sound great but unfortunately I won't be able to sample them tonight.   So I'm going for a Chilli Cod and weeping tiger which I haven't had in  years.Wow, just finished.  Very tasty.   The Chilli fish is not to be missed.    The sauce is outstanding, best Chilli sauce I have ever had!   The weeping tiger was very tasty too, a little tough but I maybe caused that by asking for into be cooked more.Anyway,   go try this place.     Good eats :)

BeqqXhzimSCtl8-0DrYNSQ.text: Excellent Thai food.Prices are not outrageous. Between 7 and 13 pounds per dish (for the most part). The massaman curry and pad thai are really good. As is the papaya salad (but spicy).The staff is friendly and happy.

jT1O2BvZaxm05uT2yZGBUw.text: Authentic Thai place? This is it.On a Wednesday night the place was packed. Seriously. Packed. Many many people were popping in and putting down their name on the list or even just contributing to the traffic jam at the door.Food wise, if you like your food hot, they do them here hot, like Thai special hot.Food comments:Morning Glory (do not order the fried cod with this, it tastes horrendous)Steamed whole sea bass (table loved this dish the most)Chilled raw prawns (omg this was so good, but super spicy - not for those who cannot eat spicy)Roast duck curry (the curry was nice, but the duck was completely overcooked and so very tough)Seafood brandy (sorry but nothing special here, just a mix of seafood)Good stuff:Staff speak perfect EnglishFood comes quite quicklyIf you want spicy you will get spicy!!!!Bad stuff:Long wait for a tableIf 3 of you order the same tea you get one teapot for some reason.4 people over ordering on the above = £20 approx = cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

R_eoJVRMD50vK-PaM7eISA.text: Let me preface by saying a few years back I spent a few weeks exploring Thailand so I consider myself a pretty good judge of Thai food. The papaya salad was spicy and decadent and every bit of authentic as you'd ever want it to be. Be forewarned all other mediocre interpretations will pale in comparison after you've tried it.Also, sautéed cod + morning glory. Just do it

EW0J0j6IP-7HjGE59InkGw.text: Excellent! I loved the soft shell crab. Will revisit this restaurant before returning home.

photos.caption: Photo of Addie's Thai Cafe - London, United Kingdom

8050UP4g9t-17Ssuxe9iEw.text: The Morning Glory was really flavourful and delicious. The Jungle Curry was a bit thin (I should have asked what it was like), but still pretty good. Service was good and the bill was pretty cheap. They wanted us to have our whole party present before they seated us. The underground seating was a bit chilly.

XVTUBCHuAHwxv9DRXSPNsg.text: I've had Thai food all over the world and this was absolutely delicious! On a Saturday night it was busy but not super crowded. They were able to seat me immediately for a late dinner for one. The service is pleasant and prompt. I enjoy being able to see the servers laugh and share moments with the crowd and that's exactly what happened. I ordered the chicken wings for my appetizer. Done expect to fill up on them considering you only get four but those four wings are spectacular. The garlic sauce is perfect, tangy and a little sweet. You taste the garlic but it's not overwhelming. My main dish I had the weeping tiger and a side order of eff fried rice. This dish is one of the best I've ever had. Steak was cooked perfectly and the sauce was even better! The egg fried rice wasn't oily or bogged down with soy sauce making it a wonderful compliment to the weeping tiger steak. I will most certainly return here and recommend it to others.

V5ljSrl6vc5wMaG6nzaJuw.text: The food here is amazing - a full range of thai style dishes including some which are very spicy (really Thai style). The best dishes for me are the grilled pork and the stir fry chilli with morning glory, and the mango sticky rice for dessert, but everything I have tried has been very nice! I have been to alot of Thai restaurants in London but I think this is the best!
